definition: Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
surname Mu
solemn/reverent/calm/burial position in an ancestral tomb (old)/old variant of 默
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
cowrie/shellfish/currency (archaic)
surname Bei

sentences.chinese: 显然穆加贝对此付之一笑。

sentences.english: Outside Leo Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe's association buttonholed me.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韦足协主席莱奥穆加贝在外面拦住我。

sentences.english: So does Mugabe, even at 85, have the capacity to change?
sentences.chinese: 那么，已经85岁高龄的穆加贝还有能力改变吗？

sentences.english: Mugabe knows he cannot go it alone.
sentences.chinese: 穆加贝明白他不能一意孤行。

sentences.english: The only person who profits from these divisions is Mr Mugabe himself.
sentences.chinese: 只有一个人从这些分歧中受益，那就是穆加贝先生。

sentences.english: Sixty-one percent of Zimbabweans have only known Robert Mugabe's rule.
sentences.chinese: 61%的津巴布韦人只知道罗伯特穆加贝。

sentences.english: Others are still susceptible to the appeal of Mr Mugabe's anti-colonialist rhetoric.
sentences.chinese: 其他人仍然受到穆加贝先生反殖民主义言论的影响。

sentences.english: Mr Mugabe says that indigenisation “recognises our sovereign right of ownership”.
sentences.chinese: 穆加贝先生称本地化是“承认我们拥有的主权权利”。

sentences.english: Yet his regime is more susceptible to pressure than it seems.
sentences.chinese: 不过，穆加贝的政权更易受到外界压力的影响。

sentences.english: Yet Mugabe apparently tries to laugh off his global infamy.
sentences.chinese: 然而穆加贝显然对他在国际社会上的臭名一笑置之。

sentences.english: In recent years, Mugabe has grown even more ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的几年中，穆加贝的残暴愈加变本加厉。

sentences.english: President Robert Mugabe launched his re-election campaign on Sunday accusing Tsvangirai of extensive political violence.
sentences.chinese: 津巴布韦总统穆加贝星期天开始了自己的连任竞选。

definition: African National Congress, ANC/abbr. for 非洲人國民大會|非洲人国民大会[Fei1 zhou1 ren2 guo2 min2 da4 hui4]
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
Indian Congress party
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
Modi (name)/Narendra Modi (1950-), Indian BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party or Indian People's Party) politician, Gujarat Chief Minister from 2001, PM from 2014
(Colonel Muammar) Gaddafi (1942-2011), de facto leader of Libya from 1969-2011
former president
Suharto (1921-2008), former Indonesian general, president of the Republic of Indonesia 1967-1998
Erdogan (name)/Recep Tayyip Erdoğan (1954-), Turkish politician, prime minister from 2003
Chavez, Spanish name
Indian Congress party
former prime minister
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
People's party (of various countries)
Pervez Musharraf (1943-), Pakistani general and politician, president 2001-2008
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad (1956-), Iranian fundamentalist politician, president of Iran 2005-2013/abbr. for 艾哈邁迪內賈德|艾哈迈迪内贾德
